moves.1. e4 c6 2. Nf3 d5 3. exd5 cxd5 4. d4 Nf: This was a tough game, and very evenly matched.
moves.6. Bf4 Bf5 7. Bd3 e6: White takes the bishop, clearing the file and giving me a stronger hold on e5.
moves.11... O-O 12. a3 Re8 13. Qd3 Ne4: Might as well take advantage of e5.
moves.14. Nxe4 fxe4: White exchanges, and my pawns are connected again, in the center, and with an attack on the Q.
moves.17... Rxc2 18. Qb3 Rc6 19. Qxb7 Rb6: White takes the pawn back.  I tried to trap his queen in the corner.
moves.20. Qa7 Bd6: White exchanges the bishops, and gets quite frisky with the rooks.
moves.21. Bxd6 Qxd6 22. Rac1 Qf6 23. Qd7 Rd8 2: I'm still trying to get that pesky queen, or at least to chase it back out.  White is having none of it and is being quite aggressive.
moves.24... Rb8: Might as well join the fray.
moves.25. Rec1 h6 26. Rxb8 Rxb8 27. Rc8+ Rxc8: We're down to queens and pawns.  I felt the outcome would be even and tenuous.  However white declined my offer of a draw.
moves.28... Kh7 29. Qc5 Qf5 30. h3 e3: Might as well get some action going.  I'm attempting to gain the initiative, by attacking his king and gaining some pawns.
moves.31. fxe3 Qb1+ 32. Kh2 Qxb2 33. Qxd5 Qxa3: White is having none of my plan, and now has a clear pawn in the center.
Again I offer a draw.  White declines.
moves.38. Qa4 Qxe3: I can easily draw here, but feel I can win and decide to go for it.
moves.40... a5: I should have gotten the king over first, then pushed the pawn.
moves.41. d6 Kg8 42. d7: It's not looking good.  My game is in dire straits at this point.
moves.42... Qb6 43. Qd2 Qd8 44. Kg2 f5 45. Qd5: Somehow my position has improved.  I feel white has a clear win here but manage to keep him away.
moves.46. Qd6+ Kf7 47. Kf2 a4: I try to shake him up with a push of the pawn and it works.
moves.48. Qc6 Ke7 49. Qxa4 Qxd7: Whew, back in the game with a slight advantage.
moves.50. Qh4+ g5: Even again.  I decide to go for either a definite win or a draw.
moves.51. Qxh6 Qd4+: A trap becomes clear, if only I make the right moves, and he doesn't see what I'm doing.
moves.52. Kg2 Qd2+ 53. Kf3: It's a win, in a very tough game.  I'm glad for the experience with the queens.

gameName: game 5 - rooks middle - queens & pawns endgame
